snippet.title: This Indian Brand is KILLING Global Brands like Anything!
snippet.description:
⭐️ Think School’s Communication course with an exclusive workshop on Chat GPT included: 
https://thethinkschool.com/sp/communication-masterclass/

Disclaimer: The views and opinions expressed in this video are those of the presenter and do not necessarily reflect the official policy or position of the alcohol brand mentioned. This video is not intended to be a form of marketing or endorsement for the alcohol brand or for the consumption of alcohol in general.

Alcohol is injurious to health and can cause serious health issues when consumed irresponsibly. We strongly advise against excessive or underage drinking.

VIDEO INTRODUCTION:

Sula Wines is one of the most incredible companies in the Indian business ecosystem and they have established such an insane dominance in the wine industry of India that while Fratelli Wines has a total land acreage of 240 Acres, Grover Zampa has 460 acres but Sula alone has an acreage of 2600 Acres!!! Which is more than its next 3 competitors combined!! 
and what's even more mind-blowing is that, in spite of having 5–10 times more inventory, while Fratelli has an average inventory time of 595 days, Grover stands at 878 days, Sula has an average inventory time of just 465 days!!! 

Which means inspite of Sula producing 5–10 times more volumne of wine, it is able push its products at a wayyy faster pace than their competition and Sula has been such a dominating player in India, that even the biggest winemakers in the world have not been successful in India!!!
As a result, Sula stands as the indisputable king in the Indian wine industry with a market share of 52%
So in this episode of the Underrated Indian Business Maharaja series, let’s try to understand, 

How did Sula wines go from being a humble start up to becoming the King of the Indian wine market?
What were their business strategies that helped them get so far ahead of their competition ?
And, most importantly, as students of business what are the lessons and study materials to help you understand Sula and the wine industry of India better?

localized.title: This Indian Brand is KILLING Global Brands like Anything!
localized.description:
⭐️ Think School’s Communication course with an exclusive workshop on Chat GPT included: 
https://thethinkschool.com/sp/communication-masterclass/

Disclaimer: The views and opinions expressed in this video are those of the presenter and do not necessarily reflect the official policy or position of the alcohol brand mentioned. This video is not intended to be a form of marketing or endorsement for the alcohol brand or for the consumption of alcohol in general.

Alcohol is injurious to health and can cause serious health issues when consumed irresponsibly. We strongly advise against excessive or underage drinking.

VIDEO INTRODUCTION:

Sula Wines is one of the most incredible companies in the Indian business ecosystem and they have established such an insane dominance in the wine industry of India that while Fratelli Wines has a total land acreage of 240 Acres, Grover Zampa has 460 acres but Sula alone has an acreage of 2600 Acres!!! Which is more than its next 3 competitors combined!! 
and what's even more mind-blowing is that, in spite of having 5–10 times more inventory, while Fratelli has an average inventory time of 595 days, Grover stands at 878 days, Sula has an average inventory time of just 465 days!!! 

Which means inspite of Sula producing 5–10 times more volumne of wine, it is able push its products at a wayyy faster pace than their competition and Sula has been such a dominating player in India, that even the biggest winemakers in the world have not been successful in India!!!
As a result, Sula stands as the indisputable king in the Indian wine industry with a market share of 52%
So in this episode of the Underrated Indian Business Maharaja series, let’s try to understand, 

How did Sula wines go from being a humble start up to becoming the King of the Indian wine market?
What were their business strategies that helped them get so far ahead of their competition ?
And, most importantly, as students of business what are the lessons and study materials to help you understand Sula and the wine industry of India better?

snippet.title: Building a MILLION DOLLAR Global Brand from Madhya Pradesh: How?
snippet.description:
⭐️ Think School’s flagship Communication course with an exclusive workshop on Chat GPT included: 
https://thethinkschool.com/sp/communication-masterclass/

VIDEO INTRODUCTION:

Hi Everybody,
The economics of TEA in India is one of the most fascinating concepts you will ever discover, and while mostpeople only know TEA as a beverage, what we often don’t see is that it is an incredible product to build a million-dollar business!
The question is, how can you build a million dollars business by selling this 10–15Rs product? Well, that’s exactly what I wondering!

And as luck would have it, I got the opportunity to meet one of the smartest founders in the tea business who goes by the name Anubhav Dubey. And his company, the Chai Sutta bar has become such a mammoth and that today, they serve 3 lakh cups of Tea every single day, have 485 stores spread across the country, and as of 2022, they have achieved a combined revenue of around Rs 150 crores !

Fun fact, they have achieved this revenue without raising a single penny from investors!
And for the first time, Anubhav has revelead all the economics behind his business model! So in this episode today, lets go deep and try to understand,

How on earth can you build a million-dollar business by selling tea?
What is the economics behind this business?
How is the business model of Chai Sutta Bar different from other Tea selling companies?
and most importantly, as students of business, what are the lessons that we need to learn from Chai Sutta Bar?

snippet.title: The New GAME Changer technology for India: REVEALED!
snippet.description:
⭐️ Think School’s flagship Communication course with an exclusive workshop on Chat GPT included: 
https://thethinkschool.com/sp/communication-masterclass/

The Tshirt company that I mentioned : https://instagram.com/down_urban?igshid=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==

VIDEO INTRODUCTION: At the Global Fintech Festival 2020, Mr Nandan Nilekani launched a revolutionary concept that could change the financial landscape of MSMEs in India and now in 2023, it is coming alive in execution!!
and the best part is that this concept is built upon the foundation of revolutionary products, like Aadhar, UPI, the GST system, and most importantly, the robust banking system of India!!
This platform that we are talking about is called the Open Credit enables network or OCEN!! and this will solve the most critical problem for the MSMEs of India which is the CREDIT GAP problem!!
and if you think its no big deal at all, take a look at this graph, in the past 10 years, the MSME sector of India has contributed to 30% of our GDP, in the past 3 years more than 40% of our exports came from MSMEs and most importantly, this segment of India alone employs over 100 Million people in the country!!! and yet when covid happened, most of the companies could not get loan because of which they could pay their rent, they could not pay their employees and eventually, they had to take loans from Money lenders at 18–30% interest!!! 
because of this even today, many MSMEs in India are still struggling to recover their profits!!! and this points towards a very very critical problem in the economy of India!

snippet.description:
⭐️ Think School’s Communication course with an exclusive workshop on Chat GPT included: 
https://thethinkschool.com/sp/communication-masterclass/

Solar Company mentioned in the video (URON ENERGY): https://www.uronenergy.com/uronoms.html

VIDEO INTRODUCTION:

On the 30th of November 2015, The Prime Minister of India proposed a revolutionary project, that could turn into a renewable energy leader of the world. In this announcement, he proposed something called the International Solar Alliance!!! This would be an alliance of 100 countries that will become the solar powerhouse of the world. and this is very very important to India because India will be the leader of this alliance considering how important renewable energy is, if this alliance is formed and operated properly, just like the middle eastern countries dominated the 20th century to become the richest nations in the world, we could achieve the same and become the renewable superpower of the world!! And this means more money, more power, and most importantly lots of business opportunities for the solar entrepreneurs of India!!!
So the question is,
What is this international solar alliance?
Why is this alliance considered to be so so powerful?
What is the advantage that India has over the Western countries?
and most importantly, as entrepreneurs of the future, what are the business opportunities for you in this Indian solar revolution?

snippet.title: What's wrong with Chinese Economy?
snippet.description:

▶️Use my code "TS27" for 27% Fee discount
▶️Applicable for first 100 Students only

⭐️ Think School’s flagship Communication course with an exclusive workshop on Chat GPT included: 
https://thethinkschool.com/sp/communication-masterclass/

VIDEO INTRODUCTION:

China is going through a series of crises, and it’s not 1 or 2 but 3 crises occurring together, which are the real estate crisis, the banking crisis and now a credit crisis!!! Five banks have already crashed, Small and medium-sized companies (SMEs) that make up a large part of the manufacturing and industrial sectors and contribute around 60% of GDP are struggling for cash, and the Chinese economy in general hit meagre 2.99% per cent growth in the fy2022!!! and all of this is because the govt of China made 1 critical mistake and this mistake has a ton of lessons that the Indian government needs to learn from!!
The question is,
In spite of such an incredible rise, why is China slowing down now?
What was the governance mistake that snowballed them into both a real estate and a banking crisis?

snippet.title: Economic CRISIS in America: Big Signal for India?
snippet.description:
🔥 Register for in-demand workshops for FREE: https://link.growthschool.io/ts 

👉 100% Discount for FIRST 1000 Thinkschool Leaners 🎁
🤯LEARN Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Management Consulting, and Product Management, Growth Hacking, Linkedin Personal Branding and more. 
👆CHECKOUT THE LINK ABOVE 👆



➡️Communication Masterclass: https://thethinkschool.com/sp/communication-masterclass/

VIDEO INTRODUCTION: On 1 st of June of 2023, the United States of America was expected to default on its debt!!! and after a long debate of whether they will or they will not, finally the United States has now suspended its debt ceiling and prevented default!! and while most people might think the US default problem is over, what we fail to see is that this is a very very big indicator of the US dollar weakening, and the fact that the US economy is not far from breaking down!!
in fact, if you look at their debt to GDP ratio, while 77% of Debt of GDP is considered to be the limit of safety for Debt to GDP ratio, India stands at 83%, UK stands 99% and US stands at 134%
and if you look at this graph, this is the highest debt to GDP ratio US has ever touched in the past 150 years and today its more than the times of great depression, both the world wars and even covid!! and every time they reached the debt ceiling they have increased it further!!! 
and they have increased the debt ceiling not once not twice for the 78 times since the 1960s!!
So even though the US got away again, with Russian aggression, Chineese power and the India's fast-growing influence, one day United states will default!! and when they do, it will not just shake the world economy but will also be a pivotal moment in the world history which might result in a shift of power!! 
So as students of business, it is very very important to study this macroeconomic situation, because this moment will affect everything starting from, world powers to the stock market to every single commodity in the international market!!!
So in this episode, let's try to understand, 
What the hell is a debt ceiling?
Why is so important in the context of US?
What happens when a country violates its debt ceiling?
and in the next 10 years, if the US defaults, how will affect the world economy?

snippet.title: How Bangalore became the SILICON valley of Asia? | Business case study
snippet.description:
⭐️ Think School’s flagship Communication course with an exclusive workshop on Chat GPT included: 
https://thethinkschool.com/sp/communication-masterclass/

VIDEO INTRODUCTION:
You don’t have to make it much past 8am before Bangalore’s notorious traffic jams become too dense to escape. For Bangalore’s 12.3 million inhabitants, outrunning heavy traffic congestions has become a refined art of navigation. But, in between petrol fumes and the frenzy of activity, spectacular tech parks, lavish hotels, and fancy restaurants testify to the genesis of a truly global and innovative metropolis. So what led to this transformation? How did Bangalore become Asia’s Silicon Valley?

VIDEO INTRODUCTION:

Go Airlines (India) Ltd was granted bankruptcy protection on Wednesday, bolstering the country's fourth-largest carrier's chances of getting back on its feet, but lessors have started mounting legal challenges to repossess planes.

The low-cost carrier recently rebranded as Go First, was plunged into a financial crisis this year, sparked by what it called "faulty" Pratt & Whitney engines that grounded about half its 54 Airbus A320neos.
